Major_Arcs.title: Circus Shenanigans
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Paul Bunyan in a circus setting, his confrontation with Billings, the sabotage attempts by Matto Grasso, and Paul's eventual departure from the circus.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Initial Conflicts
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Paul Bunyan as a circus performer and depicts the arrival of ordinary people at the circus, setting the stage for initial conflicts and events.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Circus and the Giraffe
Investigating the Cry for Help and Confronting Billings
The Proposition: Becoming the New Strong Man

sub_scenes.title: Matto Grasso's Revenge and Paul Bunyan's Exit
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Matto Grasso's escalating attempts to sabotage Paul Bunyan and the circus, culminating in Paul Bunyan's decision to leave.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Acclaim and Matto Grasso's Envy
Matto's Renewed Sabotage: The Ape Release
Discovery of the Loose Ape and Paul's Intervention
Arena Observation and Intention to Intervene
Rejection of Strongman Offer and Departure

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo's Eastern Encounters
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Marco Polo's adventures in the East, including his encounter with a severed talking head, his rescue of a tied man, and his arrival in Hi-Toun.

sub_scenes.title: Tibet, Talking Heads, and Rescue
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene presents Marco Polo's initial perilous adventures in Tibet, his discovery of a severed talking head, and his subsequent rescue of a man in need.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Awful Ogress of Tibet
Discovery of the Severed Talking Head
The Severed Head's Plea for Help

sub_scenes.title: Hi-Toun and the Witch's Castle
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Marco Polo's arrival in Hi-Toun, his encounter with the King, and his journey towards the witch's castle after meeting a starving mother.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Hi-Toun and King's Welcome
The King's Grief and the Missing Princess Lotus
Encounter with a Starving Mother and the Witch's Castle

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Castle and Capture
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Marco Polo's entry into the witch's castle, the revelation of the old woman as an ogress, the fight with her mice, and his eventual capture by a cloaked figure.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Mysterious Castle and Meeting the 'Children'
Confrontation with the Mice and Sword Defense

Major_Arcs.title: Princess Lotus's Rescue and Marriage
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Princess Lotus's imprisonment by the Ogress, her rescue by a fellow prisoner using a magic knife, and the subsequent reward of marriage.

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Dungeon and Escape
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene describes Princess Lotus's imprisonment by the Ogress, the introduction of the 'Fly Blade' knife, and the successful escape from the dungeon.

narrative_arcs.title: Dungeon Escape and Journey to Father

sub_scenes.title: Palace Arrival and Marriage Proposal
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts their arrival at the palace, the cultural misunderstanding about mourning colors, and culminates in the father's proposal of marriage as a reward.

narrative_arcs.title: Palace Arrival, Mourning Confusion, and Marriage Reward

Major_Arcs.title: The Treasure of Agra and Jordan's Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells the story of a hidden treasure, betrayal in a penal colony, and Jordan's long-awaited revenge on Captain Brooking.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Keeper and Penal Colony Setup
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces the tale of treasure told by a keeper and then shifts to a British penal colony setting, introducing the characters involved in the treasure plot.

narrative_arcs.title: Prison Colony Labor and Guard Check
Request to Speak with Captain Brooking

sub_scenes.title: Betrayal, Revenge, and Justice
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Captain Brooking's betrayal, Jordan's vow for revenge, his release from prison, and his eventual confrontation with Brooking, leading to a violent climax and police intervention.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of Betrayal and Captain's Escape
Release from Servitude and Fare to England
Arrival in England and Renewed Vengeance
Ascent to the Attic and Discovery of Treasure
Responding to Gunshot and Finding the Body
Aftermath and Calling the Homicide Squad
Moral of the Story: Money is Evil

Major_Arcs.title: Dr. Styx and the Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Dr. Styx and Henry Northrup investigating the haunted Matthews Estate, dealing with the ghost of Vincent Matthews and summoning Rosalind for forgiveness.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction of Dr. Styx and the Haunted Estate
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene introduces Dr. Styx and Henry Northrup, setting up the context of the haunted Matthews Estate, starting from a dramatic scene and transitioning to the backstory of Vincent Matthews's crime and sentencing.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Warning at Matthews Place
Warning Before Entering the Haunted House

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Resolution with Vincent Matthews' Ghost
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details Henry's encounter with Vincent Matthews' ghost, the philosophical discussion on fear and hatred, the revelation of Henry's crime, and the summoning of Rosalind for forgiveness, leading to the resolution of the haunting.

narrative_arcs.title: Unexpected Strength and Shift in Power
The Horrifying Revelation of Rosalind's Murder and Forgiveness
Plea for Rest and Conditional Forgiveness
The Test of Brotherly Love and Rejection

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Arctic Voyages and Mutiny
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc narrates the historical voyages of Henry Hudson, his relentless search for the Northwest Passage, the growing discontent among his crew, and the tragic mutiny that led to his demise.

sub_scenes.title: Hudson's Ambition and Initial Voyages
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets up Henry Hudson's historical context, his ambition to find the Northwest Passage, and his commission by the Dutch East India Company for a new voyage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Dutch East India Company's Request

sub_scenes.title: Voyage, Discontent, and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene details the voyage of the Half Moon, the growing discontent among the crew, the change of course, and the eventual mutiny against Hudson.

narrative_arcs.title: Threat of Mutiny and Change of Course
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
Hudson's Resolve and Return to Holland
New Company and Continued Search for Passage
Extreme Northerly Route and Icebound Ship
Winter Quarters and Waiting for Spring Thaw
The Ice Melts and Voyage Resumes
Crew's Refusal and Demand to Return Home
Mutineers Return Home and Face Justice

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight and the Tartar Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Hassan the Arabian Knight on a dangerous mission to rescue the daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali from Kurgan and the Dread Tartars, showcasing his bravery, combat skills, and eventual romantic reward.

sub_scenes.title: Mission Briefing and Perilous Journey
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene sets up Hassan's mission, his briefing by the Caliph, his departure, and his perilous journey towards the Tartar territory, including warnings from a traveler.

narrative_arcs.title: The Summons and the Dangerous Mission
The Rescue Mission: Daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali
Signs of the Enemy at the Oasis

sub_scenes.title: Infiltration, Capture, and Trial by Combat
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene covers Hassan's infiltration of the Tartar camp, his initial success, his discovery and capture, and the challenge proposed by Kurgan for a trial by combat.

narrative_arcs.title: Approaching the Tartar Camp Under Nightfall
Cloak as a Disguise and Infiltration Plan
Reaching the Prisoner's Tent and Contact
Discovery and Confrontation by Tartar Guards
Capture and Recognition as an Outsider
Terms of Combat and Kurgan's Doubt

sub_scenes.title: Combat Victory and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: This sub-scene depicts Hassan's combat against the Tartar warriors, his victory, Kurgan honoring his word, and the romantic conclusion with the Caliph's daughter.

narrative_arcs.title: Victory Shout and Defiant Last Words
Impending Departure and a Necessary Kiss
